instructions: Tap the chart, then tap Edit Series. Tap the series you want to edit, then use the controls in the menu to make changes. The changes affect only the selected data series. To change another series, tap All Series, tap the series you want to edit, then make changes. To edit multiple series, tap Select, tap two or more series, then tap Format Selected Series.
Tap the chart, then tap the Format menu . Tap Style, then tap General. Drag the Gaps Between Columns, Gaps Between Bars, or Gaps Between Sets slider to set the amount of space.

Tap the chart you want to change, tap the Format button , then tap Style. Drag the Rounded Corners slider. If you don t see the Rounded Corners slider, swipe up from the bottom of the controls. To round only the two outside corners of each bar or column (those farthest from the axis), turn on Outside Corners Only.

Tap the chart to select it. Tap the Format button , then tap Chart. Swipe up to see the Depth slider (if you don t see it), then do any of the following: Adjust the depth: Drag the Depth slider to the right to make the chart appear deeper, or drag it to the left to make it appear less deep. Change the shape of columns or bars: Tap Column Shape or Bar Shape, then choose either Rectangle or Cylinder.

Tap the chart, then tap the Format button . Tap Chart, then turn on Bevels. The bevels control appears only when a 3D stacked bar chart, 3D stacked column chart, or 3D pie chart is selected. If you don t see Bevels, swipe up from the bottom of the controls.
Tap the donut chart to select it, then tap the Format button . Drag the Inner Radius slider to make the opening larger or smaller.
